history.content: Reach out to people. It's much easier to land an interview by directly contacting a recruiter (check LinkedIn) or getting references from someone you know. Add any relevant work experience, personal projects, and LinkedIn/GitHub profile to your resume.

children.subject:
You've probably already considered it, but if possible I think it might be best to hustle for an internship this summer and finish school in the fall.

Things I think are worth noting:

  • a reasonably paid internship should partially offset the cost of school
  • probably easier finding something full-time at Fall career fairs than during the summer
  • a good internship with no experience would be much easier to find than a good full-time job with no experience
    • high chance of return offer?

That being said, I don't think it's a huge deal if you do graduate with no internship experience -- it might make life a little harder in the short term but it's far from uncommon.

history.content:
I am planning to graduate in the summer (will be taking classes during the summer). Unfortunately it is unlikely I will be able to intern during this time, unless there are part-time internships. I have not done any internships at tech companies at all, so I am extremely worried about my prospects after I graduate. I have some workstudy experience, some personal projects, a decent GPA, but that's it.

What should I absolutely begin doing to maximize my chances of securing a decent salaried (>$100k+) CS-related job after I graduate?

I prefer to graduate in the summer rather than fall because it will save me some money.
history.subject: Going to graduate soon CS, no internship. Worried!
